description.value:
>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.themes.Item.2uE8YWDhVkeahMcw]{Wild Warden}

You harm creatures of the wilderness only when necessary for survival, preferring to simply knock them unconscious whenever possible. When you use a weapon that deals lethal damage to deal nonlethal damage to a creature of the animal, plant, or vermin type that you have identified with a successful @Check[type:life-science]{Life Sciences check}, you don't take the standard -4 penalty to your attack rolls. In addition, if you are dealing nonlethal damage in this way and score a critical hit, you can choose not to impose any of your weapon's critical hit effects. Finally, you can use @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.tVUA3IPcOfyU1g19]{Life Science} to provide @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.d4fcGwOcrsuYrwGH#first-aid]{first aid} (as per the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.d4fcGwOcrsuYrwGH]{Medicine} task) to creatures of the animal, plant, and vermin types.
